channel.title: Refactoring help
channel.description:
Hi there, im studying/learning how the rsc client and server works, and i've been going through an older client just doing some refactoring,
okay, I have gameImage, and I have gameImage.cdd, example: gameImage.cdd(l, i1, j1, k1, k2, l2, 0, 0, false); so I realise gameImage goes back to 'class k' which extends 'j', so I go to 'class j' and find,
public void cdd(int i, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1, int l1, int i2, boolean flag)
which contains a bunch of maths, I get that it's easier to refactor stuff that has text in it to identify what it is, but how are you supposed to know what this does?
Sorry if im off track im really new to this.
cheers
EDIT:
Oh I see, System.out.println("error in sprite clipping routine"); it has the error's under each, is this the only way to identify?
EDIT 2: no, there isn't errors for each an alot are the same errors, =\

item.title: Refactoring help
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:8, topic:353085”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=449398.msg3297951#msg3297951 date=1281066410]

…any character from an ancient Germanic alphabet used in Scandinavia from the 3rd century to the Middle Ages; “each rune had its own magical significance”…

…

[ul][li]scene, picture, view[/li]
[li]A specific type of space[/li][/ul]

…

a space in which there are runes (the stones with inscriptions you use to cast your magical spells)
makes pretty good sense to me. the reason GameImage is a bad name is because it does not represent a generic image used by a game. it instead provides you a raster and an extensive set of 2d graphics routines to apply on the raster. it reminded me of the concept of a surface as in SDL_Surface so i named it Surface.

go back to rs2 section, we dont need anyone in these parts of the forums acting like a douche, we already have kryptix to deal with…
[/quote]

are you retarded? nowhere in that post did i act like a douche; don’t rage because you don’t understand it. regardless what rsc dev NEEDS is people who know what they’re doing, and oddly enough people like you are exactly what they need to dispose of.[/quote]

Good luck running the pony show. I’m serious too.

RSC dev died and will remain dead regardless of who comes, 95% of the people you are trying to “help” are lost causes. Do what everyone else did and keep to yourself, why else do you think we have turned it into a “discussion” section now?

@OP: You need to take into account, that not everything that was de-obfuscated was turned back into simple english, so analyzing any of the code will require you to understand math algorithms at an “some-what” advanced level. Advice is to look at what you know/understand (code wise), and work your way from there. Plus, wasn’t the “gameImage” class involving assembling shapes/boxes to draw menu items?

Read full topic

go back to rs2 section, we dont need anyone in these parts of the forums acting like a douche, we already have kryptix to deal with…

makes pretty good sense to me. the reason GameImage is a bad name is because it does not represent a generic image used by a game. it instead provides you a raster and an extensive set of 2d graphics routines to apply on the raster. it reminded me of the concept of a surface as in SDL_Surface so i named it Surface.[/quote]

item.title: Refactoring help
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

define:rune:

…any character from an ancient Germanic alphabet used in Scandinavia from the 3rd century to the Middle Ages; “each rune had its own magical significance”…

[quote=“http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/-scape”]…

[ul][li]scene, picture, view[/li]
[li]A specific type of space[/li][/ul]

…[/quote]
a space in which there are runes (the stones with inscriptions you use to cast your magical spells)
makes pretty good sense to me. the reason GameImage is a bad name is because it does not represent a generic image used by a game. it instead provides you a raster and an extensive set of 2d graphics routines to apply on the raster. it reminded me of the concept of a surface as in SDL_Surface so i named it Surface.

Read full topic

item.title: Refactoring help
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

super_:

you analyze it to figure out what it does… what the fuck else? not to mention GameImage is a really bad name

-.- why are you such a critic?

Runescape is a bad name.

Rune or Runite: an entity in-game you can use.

Scape: A scene; a view. Often used in combination:

When the fuck do i use my armor/node/pickaxe to have a view in this magical world / 2d scene??

bad name is bad

Read full topic

item.title: Refactoring help
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

Hi there, im studying/learning how the rsc client and server works,
and i’ve been going through an older client just doing some refactoring,

okay, I have gameImage,
and I have gameImage.cdd, example: gameImage.cdd(l, i1, j1, k1, k2, l2, 0, 0, false);
so I realise gameImage goes back to ‘class k’ which extends ‘j’,
so I go to ‘class j’ and find,

public void cdd(int i, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1, int l1,
int i2, boolean flag)

which contains a bunch of maths,
I get that it’s easier to refactor stuff that has text in it to identify what it is,
but how are you supposed to know what this does?

Sorry if im off track im really new to this.

cheers

EDIT:

Oh I see,
System.out.println(“error in sprite clipping routine”);
it has the error’s under each, is this the only way to identify?

EDIT 2:
no, there isn’t errors for each an alot are the same errors, =\
